intro: Thelypodium paniculatum, commonly known as the clustered false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of blue to purple flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
